restrain.translation[0].definitions[0].d: to stop someone from doing something, often by using physical force
restrain.translation[0].definitions[0].e: I had to restrain her from running out into the street.
He had to be restrained from using violence.
restrain.translation[0].definitions[1].d: to control your own emotions or behaviour
restrain.translation[0].definitions[1].e: Renwick restrained a feeling of annoyance.
She could barely restrain herself from hitting him.
restrain.translation[0].definitions[2].d: to control or limit something that is increasing too much
restrain.translation[0].definitions[2].e: Price rises should restrain consumer spending.
restrain.translation[1].definitions[0].d: to control or limit something that is starting to increase
restrain.translation[1].definitions[0].e: tough rules to restrain the creation of monopolies
A cut in consumer credit would restrain an economic recovery.
